Result.Abstract: A new class of visuomotor neuron has been recently discovered in the monkey's premotor cortex: mirror neurons. These neurons respond both when a particular action is performed by the recorded monkey and when the same action, performed by another individual, is observed. Mirror neurons appear to form a cortical system matching observation and execution of goal-related motor actions. Experimental evidence
Result.Title: Mirror neurons and the simulation theory of mind-reading

Result.Abstract: Topically applied opioids have provided effective analgesia without adverse effects, including tolerance, in adult patients with painful inflammatory conditions. Result.Title: Peripheral opioids in inflammatory pain

Result.Abstract: A conception of social epistemology is articulated with links to studies of science and opinion in such disciplines as history, sociology, and political science. Result.Abstract: Icosahedral Al71Pd21,Mn8 quasicrystals have been grown from the ternary melt via a ‘self-flux’ technique. Result.Title: On the growth of icosahedral Al–Pd–Mn quasicrystals from the ternary melt

Result.Abstract: Some recent advances in the study of quasicrystals at Ames Laboratory are reviewed. In particular, growth from the melt of large, high-quality, single-grain quasicrystals is described in detail for icosahedral R–Mg–Zn and decagonal Al–Ni–Co. In addition, the magnetic properties of the rare-earth-containing icosahedral R–Mg–Zn quasicrystals are discussed.
Result.Title: Recent advances in the study of quasicrystals
